list.abs: 公民不服从（civil disobedience）（Civil disobedience），指发现某一条或某部分法律、行政指令是不合理时，主动拒绝遵守政府或强权的若干法律、要求 …
公民抗命（civil disobedience）（Civil Disobedience）涵义是守法的公民发现某一条或某部分法律、行政指令是不合理时，所处的态度和行动。开放分类：  …
牛津大学英语词典 ... dislike 不喜欢 * disobedient 不服从的 * distrust 不信任. 4.
一注码,心态一失衡,轮盘好像就不听话(Disobedient)了.这个问题(Problem)得用哲学角度来看(View),因为轮盘的随机性和人的主观性是相.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French desobedience, from an alteration of ecclesiastical Latin inoboedientia

entry.def: Disobedience is deliberately not doing what someone tells you to do, or what a rule or law says that you should do.

means.word_mean: 2. the trait of being unwilling to obey

auth_sentence.content: He was...gated for a fortnight for disobedience and contumacy.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was...gated for a fortnight for disobedience and contumacy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was...gated for a fortnight for disobedience and contumacy.

auth_sentence.content: An Iron Rod to bruise and breake Thy disobedience.
auth_sentence.res_content: An Iron Rod to bruise and breake Thy disobedience.

auth_sentence.content: Nationalist figurehead Mahatma Gandhi launches anti-British civil disobedience campaign.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nationalist figurehead Mahatma Gandhi launches anti-British civil disobedience campaign.

sentences.en: I shall overlook your disobedience this time.
sentences.cn: 这次,我不计较你不服从。

sentences.en: His behaviour was seen as another act of disobedience.
sentences.cn: 他的行为被看作又一次的违抗。

sentences.en: Father slapped the boy on the face for disobedience.
sentences.cn: 父亲因儿子不听话而打了他一耳光。
